title: Obari
author: Obari
created_time: July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMLast edit: July 23, 2024, 01:33:02 PM by Obari
content: I recently made comment on a Thread by @NotATether and it actually made me had a deep thought on what really the fate of bitcoin would be without the internet because we are know that we’re in a world of possibilities and anything(absolutely) can be possible and what if maybe there was a global shutdown on the internet m, what will happen to bitcoin ?My question was born out of curiosity and I’m not actually inclined on the technicalities of bitcoin and I just want to know the fate of bitcoin if there was no internet for maybe 24 hours

comments.author: BlackBoss_
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMMy question was born out of curiosity and I’m not actually inclined on the technicalities of bitcoin and I just want to know the fate of bitcoin if there was no internet for maybe 24 hours If the Internet is lost in 24 hours, the world has many bigger problems than Bitcoin. But if the Internet connection loss is only temporary, 24 hours, 48 hours or 72 hours but will resume, Bitcoin blockchain will continue after that. Meanwhile, people can not do bank transfers too if they don't use Satellite Internet from SpaceX company.Your bitcoin in your non custodial wallet will still be your bitcoin. Only you can access it with private keys and Internet connection availability or loss won't cause you any loss of your bitcoin.[Total privacy Bitcoin]: off grid Transactions LoRaWan/goTenna.Your transaction only gets confirmation if Bitcoin miners and nodes work so Internet connection is a prerequisite.

comments.author: Iranus
comments.body: If the world temporarily lost the internet, probably nothing too serious would happen to bitcoin, but if the internet suddenly stopped working for a long time or disappeared, that would mean bitcoin would no longer exist. But the internet is like water in our world, without water the world will perish and if the internet is lost the world will stop developing and return to the stone age. So this scenario will never happen so you don't need to worry and think too much about this issue. I can't think of any scenario in which the Internet could disappear from the world, even World War III wouldn't make it disappear. Unless we encounter the destruction of the earth like the time of the dinosaurs.

comments.author: Helena Yu
comments.body: It will cause short term dump.People will choose to withdraw everything that require internet connection e.g. cash in banks, digital fiat, stock, gold's IOU, Bitcoin, altcoins etc. This is a good time to buy Bitcoin at the dip since internet connection will not completely disappear, most people already gets addicted with digitalization.As long as you hold your coins in non custodial wallet, you don't need to afraid since you will not lose your coins.

comments.author: passwordnow
comments.body: Internet is number 1 requirement for Bitcoin to continue, I've read some thoughts in the past about having radio waves and satellite signals, I'm not sure if that's doable but it seems promising as an alternative to the internet if ever doomsday will ever come. If it will come as a means of doomsday, I don't even think that there's something to worry with as we're all doomed by that time.Quote from: Iranus on July 22, 2024, 09:03:09 AMIf the world temporarily lost the internet, probably nothing too serious would happen to bitcoin, but if the internet suddenly stopped working for a long time or disappeared, that would mean bitcoin would no longer exist. Bitcoin remains to be existent even if there will be a shutdown of internet. Its operations, transactions and confirmations will be stopped if the entire world will have no internet at all. But with all the modern technologies that we have, it's interesting to read if there are good people working on this technology just to be prepared when the unexpected has come to the world as it won't only cover Bitcoin but also the companies that are solely reliant to internet for its daily operations.

comments.author: Franctoshi
comments.body: Since after the .com bubble (internet) likely around 1999-2000 if I'm not wrong, when the digital world became important to everyone, the world we are living today is now one like the "Body and soul " where if there is no soul, the body becomes lifeless, and if you check, the world has becomes so much addicted to internet to the extent that it has become part of us that we can't go back or literally live without internet as almost everything we do in our world today (90%-95%) is hugely dependent on the internet processing, taking you for instance, The payment system, which almost everything is dependent upon for our day-to-day transactions hugely depends on internet to function.The faith of Bitcoin without internet would be as much far worse than other things, in the sense that Bitcoin isn't a physical assets/money, as it depends on the internet to run.

comments.author: EL MOHA
comments.body: I think we have seen many threads created on this exact topic and the answer remains that without internet the bitcoin network wouldn’t exist and aside that many things in the world will stop to function. Banks cannot process your withdrawals and as such even to get physical cash from the bank will be impossible except for those who hoard or stach fiat cash at home. Even places like hospitals will be in trouble since some machines works with internet connections there too. So bitcoin will be the least of all worries if the internet collapses except for someone who has its funds all in bitcoin Quote from: Obari on July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMMy question was born out of curiosity and I’m not actually inclined on the technicalities of bitcoin and I just want to know the fate of bitcoin if there was no internet for maybe 24 hours If it is slightly for 24 hours some people will panic and when it comes up again I believe there will be FUDs spread about it and could lead to some investors taking some coins off and turning them to cash. On bitcoin network all transactions will just stop and continue later once it gets back. Since it is a total universal shutdown nothing will change in the network, if it is Some part that experiences that then after they have internet back they can just synchronize or update their servers back.

comments.body: The bigger question you should try to answer first is, what will ever happen in this world that will take internet off, if it humanly possible the attack could have been done by now, so as long as internet can go off same with Bitcoin and that is why bitcoin is referred to as the currency of the internet, so let stop assuming the possibility of that and focus more on important issues to discuss about.Internet is a global tool, and this have it basis on government since the government also rely on the internet to survive in it operations, so if government is not against internet, what then can be against it although I most say that the internet is the basis for bitcoin existence so if anything goes wrong with the internet, there won't be access to many things and that also includes bitcoin blockchain and wallets, so alot depends on the internet, that is why everyone is protecting the internet with all the strength in them, government taking the leads.

comments.author: fuguebtc
comments.body: Agree with OP that anything can happen but honestly, I've never thought about the worldwide internet disruption scenario and I don't think it will happen. Because that would cause terrible damage to our world because our world is almost digitized and everyone is connected to the internet to a certain extent. But if the unthinkable does happen, I believe that bitcoin like other internet-based services will be temporarily disrupted and will cause some temporary panic, and everything will return to normal once the internet is restored.

comments.author: _act_
comments.body: Do you know that different countries in the world have their own power generation which is different from others but only few countries are depending on another country. If something bad happens in United States for example and the power supply was damaged, there would still be power supply in Asia, Australia, Africa, Europe and South America. Even there would be light in countries like Mexico and Canada which border United States. If there is no power supply in the world with how this world is right now, what can cause that to happen would be what that wanted to destroy the world. And when no power supply again, I believe the world would have been destroyed.

comments.author: Dr.Bitcoin_Strange
comments.body: First, can you imagine what will happen if the internet stops working? Not only Bitcoin will be affected, but many things will stop working, and it's going to affect everyone. It's going to reduce the productivity of many companies, and for those people that are keeping their coins on centralized exchanges, they will be stuck there till everything starts working perfectly again. But if you have your coin in a self-custodial wallet, you don't have to be scared because your coin is safe there until the internet connection is restored.So far as I know, it is not possible for the whole world to go completely out of internet connection.It cannot happen; even if it does happen in the future, it will only affect some countries.

comments.author: Davidvictorson
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMI recently made comment on a Thread by @NotATether and it actually made me had a deep thought on what really the fate of bitcoin would be without the internet because we are know that we’re in a world of possibilities and anything(absolutely) can be possible and what if maybe there was a global shutdown on the internet m, what will happen to bitcoin ?In my estimation, what happens to bitcoin if the internet is down would depend on what caused the disaster. If it was a massive distributed denial-of-service (DDoS) attack or a hack then the infrastructure would be intact and eventually the internet could be restored. But, assuming it was a Global War or a massive asteroid, or a Solar Flare, I think that the world's internet infrastructure would be too severely damaged to be restored fast enough to support any bitcoin transaction or humanities dire needs. At that point nothing would matter but survival goods and services.

comments.author: seoincorporation
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMI recently made comment on a Thread by @NotATether and it actually made me had a deep thought on what really the fate of bitcoin would be without the internet because we are know that we’re in a world of possibilities and anything(absolutely) can be possible and what if maybe there was a global shutdown on the internet m, what will happen to bitcoin ?My question was born out of curiosity and I’m not actually inclined on the technicalities of bitcoin and I just want to know the fate of bitcoin if there was no internet for maybe 24 hours Bitcoin is a protocol just like the mail protocol on port 25, or the file transfer protocol on port 21, bitcoin works as a protocol on port 8333, and it needs the internet to work fine, Without internet people would be able to create and sign transaction but not to broadcast it in the network. This is like trying to send an email without the internet, it is just impossible.If the internet is just gone for 24 hours, then things will get back to normal when the internet comes back, all will auto-connect again.

comments.author: Casdinyard
comments.body: Quote from: Obari on July 22, 2024, 08:00:32 AMI recently made comment on a Thread by @NotATether and it actually made me had a deep thought on what really the fate of bitcoin would be without the internet because we are know that we’re in a world of possibilities and anything(absolutely) can be possible and what if maybe there was a global shutdown on the internet m, what will happen to bitcoin ?My question was born out of curiosity and I’m not actually inclined on the technicalities of bitcoin and I just want to know the fate of bitcoin if there was no internet for maybe 24 hours  Bitcoin is heavily dependent on the existence of the internet, and should it halt for a significant amount of time, major repercussions will ensue. Transactions will not go through, panic will ensue, the rest of us who kept our coins on air-locked computers will be good but with the prospect of never seeing nor being able to access the internet again, from let's say, a solar radiation that would disrupt technology as it stands today, the whole cryptocurrency world, as well as the whole planet is going to miserably suffer. Bitcoin may not be pegged to any currency right now but it relies heavily on the internet. It's the medium at which it travels. Take the internet out of the equation and bitcoin wouldn't work. A small disruption or outrage wouldn't cause much problems, cryptocurrencies are made to be resilient to such after all. But prolonged outages? That's another story.
